intro: Auriculardisia hammelii, commonly known as the golden cup fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ear-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its fronds are usually bright green and have a leathery texture. The spores are produced on the undersides of the fronds, which are clustered in sori.
